newsitem.title: USA: Ceridian integrates human resource units.
newsitem.headline: Ceridian integrates human resource units.

text.p: Ceridian Corp said Friday it has integrated two of its human resource businesses, Ceridian Employer Services and TesserAct Technology.
The new business, called Ceridian Employer Services, will provide human resource management systems, outsourced payroll and tax-filing services, and in-house payroll and benefits software.

"This organizational change formalizes the integration efforts we began when we acquired TesserAct Technology in 1994," said Ron James, president and chief executive officer of Ceridian Human Resources Group.
"Since the acquisition, we have been focusing on synergies and decided that the time was right to formalize the integration of the two businesses," he said.
The newly integrated Ceridian Employer Services business serves more than 30,000 customers, including 30 percent of those in the Fortune 100.
